title: Unbind default Firefox keybindings
content:
Hi there, I'd like the option to unbind default keybindings. Specifically, the Ctrl+W to close a tab binding. I reflexively hit ctrl+W when I want to delete a word in a text box (from emacs/shell/vim/etc) and this has resulted several times in me closing the tab I was on and losing the text I was writing. It would be useful to me to be able to disable this keybinding so that I don't continue having these accidents. More generally, I imagine that some users will find some keybindings annoying and want to disable or maybe remap them.

So this is half a feature request, and also half a support request if anyone has suggestions for workarounds in the meantime.

title: Firefox de escritorio y los idiomas.
content:
Hola:

Vengo examinando desde hace tiempo que tanto los navegadores como la pagina desde la que escribo no estan en español, verdaderamente es un girigay pues hay cosas en español y otras en ingles en la misma pagina, otro tanto ocurre con los nevegadores, en la configuracion en la opcion de seguridad en "Protección contra el rastreo mejorada" y algunas cosas cosas mas estan mezcladas explicaciones en español y en ingles dando la impresion de que como ocurre desde hace bastante tiempo y nadie ha solucionado el problema se puede catalogar de "discriminacion", falta de atencion al producto que en la propaganda no se ven estos errores, de ello me doy cuenta que como la propaganda interesa y en el resto NO pues a joderse los usuarios que hablan español ¿No?. En si como yo instalo muchos equipos nuevos y reinstalo sistemas y aplicaciones NO puedo implementar un navegador que no esta conforme con la propaganda que hace mozilla y de su codigo que dice en muchos "sitios" de la misma "Español", algun cliente se queja y cuando se intenta una configuracion por telefono al no hablar ingles surgen los problemas. Por ello a partir de hoy las maquinas que instale y que vengan a reparacion o revision no llevaran Firefox por el simple hecho de que no da la talla aun anunciando que si y eso es mentir a los usuarios. Me encantaria seguir con firefox pero al llevar tanto tiempo (4 años quizas mas) sin solucionar este problema del navegador y de sus paginas me doy cuenta que es un sistema que esta en el olvido por parte de Mozilla, por ello tengo que decantarme por Brave o quizas Vivaldi u otros navegadores donde la atencion y el respeto a sus clientes y seguidores sea correcta y sin publicidad engañosa. Saludos cordiales.
creator: COSMOS2K

title: Cannot Make Firefox As My Default Browser.
content:
Every time I login on my computer, there is already an open Firefox webpage with a dialog box asking me if I want Firefox to be my primary default browser. Once I click "Set a Default Browse", a Microsoft Edge webpage appears giving me a list of choices of Microsoft application to select to be my browser. Firefox is not on the list. There is also a dialog box that appears on the lower right corner of the screen showing me the steps on how to make Firefox my default browser. The choices are "Show Me How" and "No Thanks". When I click the "Show me how", I am taken to Firefox setting, once I click the "Make Default" I am taken back to the list of Microsoft applications to choose as my browser. The bottom line is I cannot make Firefox my default browser anymore. In fact, I am not even sure if I am sending this message to Firefox or Mozilla. This is the URL that I see on this https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/firefox/form.

Would you please check and correct the problem. I cannot make Firefox my default browser. Would you check if Firefox is my default browser.

title: How to 'Clear' or 'Delete' Private Tab entries/items in the History 'Recently Closed Tabs' field.
content: Firefox claims does NOT save site/URL visit information while in Private Mode. And I thought that was true. However, I just discovered that Firefox DOES SAVE Private Mode URL/Site visits - in this specific place. I don't know how long the history will be saved - it looks like at least as long as the Window is open. I want to keep most of my open Private Tabs open - but want to Delete/Clear the ones I'm done with. I thought/understood that Private window/tab/visit info was not tracked/saved - and it's not saved in History, or Searchable. But it appears that this doesn't apply to the Recently Closed Tabs MenuItem. And there seems to be NO 'delete' or 'clear' option for this field. I can't find any reference to the subject in the Forum or Articles. The picture I've attached is NOT of the Recently Closed Tabs while in Private Browsing, but is the same MenuItem and field contents. Thanks for your interest. I'm hoping someone can help me figure out how to delete/clear this specific history.
